text:
Now you know
I don't like gossip,

but I heard his wife
was so furious,

she chased him down
a freeway for three hours
with a dry pool noodle.
A dry pool noodle?

No, Janice, it was 20 minutes,
and it was a wet toilet brush.
Wet? That's nasty.

You don't know.
You weren't there.
And neither were you, boo.
I love this place so much.

And they were only
married three days.
It was two,

and that wedding,
mmph, was a mess.
Fake flowers.

- Tacky.
- Whoo.

You ain't said nothing
but a word.
Wait, it's just getting good.

Well, you know,
relationships are hard.
Not for our new stylist.

She's secretly dating
a local businessman.
But you didn't hear it from me.
How could we not?

You're the only
one talking, Janice.

Well, keep talking, Janice.
This is getting juicy.
He owns a dry cleaners.
It's a restaurant.
Just because you say it loud,
don't make it right, Janice.

Yeah, girl.
Uh-huh! A restaurant?

She belter get her a man
that can cook.

- I think he owns the Chill Gr--
- ( dryer blowing )
The Chill, what?
Oh, they are totally in love.

Wait, in love?
Who's in love? I--

I just want to know if
they talking about my daddy.

I'm just chilling.
I'm just right here.
Just hearing them almost...

- Did she just--
- Yeah, she did.
Alice, time to go!
